msItem.title: Prick of Conscience
msItem.note: The interpolated or 'eight-book' version, for which see Ann Killian, “Menacing Books: The Prick of Conscience and the Rhetoric of Reproof,” Yearbook of Langland Studies 31 (2017), 5–41.
msItem.bibl: Robert E. Lewis and Angus McIntosh, A Descriptive Guide to the Manuscripts of the “Prick of Conscience”, Medium Ævum Monographs, New Series 12 (Oxford: Society for the Study of Medieval Languages and Literature, 1982), 106–7 (MV 73).
msItem.textLang: Middle English (dialect of Essex, with probable SW Midland relicts, eLALME LP 6080) with some Latin

msItem.note: Condition of a bond of William Ayer to Geoffrey Skole (or possibly 'Skold') relating to tenements in the parish of 'Brumfyld' [Broomfield] in Essex, not dated; 16th century addition.

supportDesc.support: parchment (FSOS), several leaves with irregular edges
supportDesc.foliation: i, 1-129 every fifth folio in 19th-century pencil.
supportDesc.collation: 1(8)-15(8) (fols. 1-120), 16(seven, structure uncertain); catchwords (in red ink on fols. 8v, 48v)
supportDesc.condition: Mould damage, severe in places; fols. 121-7 remounted on paper.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in ink for one column of 40 lines; ruled space 205 125

handDesc.handNote: One scribe, mixed hand: anglicana with some secretary forms.

musicNotation.p: Notation on a three-line stave added in the margin of fol. 47r.

decoDesc.decoNote: Five-line puzzle initial T in red and blue, flourished in red and blue, fol. 1r, extending into a partial penwork border; elsewhere initials in blue, flourished in red, usually of 2-3 lines.

binding.p: Quarter-leather binding with marbled boards (18th century?); fragment of an earlier vellum binding (?) on the front pastedown.

history.provenance: Perhaps written in Essex (cf. dialect), and with some evidence of Essex provenance to the 16th century. Fol. 45r, Purgatorium quod Ric. FizNychol, 15th century (?): for Richard FitzNichol of Halstead, Essex, active c. 1430, see Cal. Inquisitions Post Mortem XXIV.179 and Feet of Fines for Essex IV 1423-1547, no. 81.
Fol. 43r, Walter Lylinge his writing hand you shall see and understande , 16th century
Document related to Broomfield, Essex, added in the 16th century, fol. 127v.
history.acquisition: Acquired by the Bodleian before 1680; 'olim 213', fol. 1r.

recordHist.source: Description (Nov. 2021) by Matthew Holford. Previously described in the Summary Catalogue. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 2 Part 2, p. 728

revisionDesc.change: James Cummings Up-converted the markup using https://github.com/jamescummings/Bodleian-msDesc-ODD/blob/master/convertTolkien2Bodley.xsl
